panels.description: Cluster status reported by Elastic Search (green, yellow, red)
panels.title: Status

panels.description: Elastic Search Version
panels.title: Version

panels.description: #Master Nodes : should be 3 masters to have good performances and availability at all time
panels.title: Master

panels.description: including master/data/client nodes
panels.title: Nodes

panels.description: #Data Nodes : should be at least 3
panels.title: Data

panels.description: equivalent of tables for a DB
panels.title: Indices

panels.description: 1 means there is 1 copy in addition to primary so there are 2 shards in total
panels.title: Replicas

panels.description: Pending Tasks : cluster-level changes (e.g. create index, update mapping, allocate or fail shard) which have not yet been executed.
panels.title: Pending

panels.description: Docs
panels.title: Docs

panels.description: Sum of all indices including replicas
panels.title: Indices Size

panels.description: Number of cluster active shards
panels.title: Active

panels.description: Number of cluster active primary shards
panels.title: Primary

panels.description: Number of cluster initializing shards
panels.title: Initializing

panels.description: Number of cluster relocating shards
panels.title: Relocating

panels.description: Number of cluster delayed unassigned shards
panels.title: Unassigned

panels.description: Max number of rejected bulk operations, means Elastic is saturated if > 30 (probably needs to scale up/out or decrease replicas)
panels.title: Rejections

panels.description: Average query time in Elastic, should not exceed 50ms
panels.title: Avg Query

panels.description: Max query time in Elastic, should not exceed 200ms
panels.title: Max Query

panels.description: Avg #Docs per seconds issued to ElasticSearch per DN
panels.title: Avg Ingestion rate by DN

panels.description: Max #Docs per seconds issued to ElasticSearch per DN
panels.title: Max Ingestion rate by DN

panels.description: List of RED indices in Elasticsearch. Generally, index is red due to unassigned/relocating primary shards. Check associated panels for more info.
panels.title: Red Indices

panels.description: List of Yellow indices in Elasticsearch. Generally, index is red due to unassigned/relocating replica shards. Check associated panels for more info.
panels.title: Yellow Indices

panels.description: Count of unassigned shards for indices. Data Node unavailibility, bad Routing or Allocation rules, shard count limit are the primary cause of unassigned shards in the cluster.
panels.title: Unassigned Shards

panels.description: Count of relocating shards for indices. Relocation is a normal process in Elasticsearch cluster. It may take time to complete.
panels.title: Relocating Shards

panels.description: Count of initializing shards for indices.
panels.title: Initializing Shards

panels.description: Number of different shard for selected index
panels.title: Shard Count

panels.description: Query Time by Node per selection
panels.title: Query Time

panels.description: Distribution by index
panels.title: Query Time Index Distribution

panels.description: Query Time by Index per selection
panels.title: Query Time Index

panels.description: Indexing Time by Node per selection
panels.title: Indexing Time

panels.description: Distribution by index
panels.title: Indexing Time Index Distribution

panels.description: Indexing Time by Index per selection
panels.title: Indexing Time Index

panels.title: Docs

panels.title: Index Docs Distribution

panels.description: Stacked graph
panels.title: Index Docs

panels.description: Rate of inserted documents for selected nodes
panels.title: Docs Ingestion rate

panels.description: Elastic search get in degraded mode when > 85% usage
panels.title: Node Usage %

panels.description: Distribution
panels.title: Index Used Distribution

panels.title: Node Storage Size

panels.title: Node Used

panels.description: Stacked graph

panels.title: Ops Time Distribution

panels.description: Active thread pools

panels.title: Queued

panels.title: Completed

panels.title: Rejected

panels.title: CPU Usage

panels.description: For more JVM metrics, please check 'Java Pods' dash

targets.expr: label_replace(((max by (name)(jvm_memory_pool_used_bytes{pod=~"$name", pool=~"PS Eden Space|G1 Eden Space|PS Survivor Space|G1 Survivor Space|Par Eden Space|Par Survivor Space|young|survivor"}) OR vector(0))+max by (name)(jvm_memory_pool_used_bytes{pod=~"$name", pool=~"PS Old Gen|G1 Old Gen|CMS Old Gen|ZHeap|old"})),"alias","$1","name","elasticsearch-(.*)")

((max(jvm_memory_pool_max_bytes{pod=~"$name", pool=~"PS Eden Space|G1 Eden Space|PS Survivor Space|G1 Survivor Space|Par Eden Space|Par Survivor Space|young|survivor"}) OR vector(0))+max(jvm_memory_pool_max_bytes{pod=~"$name", pool=~"PS Old Gen|G1 Old Gen|CMS Old Gen|ZHeap|old"}))

panels.title: JVM Memory Used

panels.description: Should not exceed 5% in average otherwise the performance of the application is degraded
panels.title: Time spent in GC

panels.title: Query Cache Size

panels.title: Query Cache Hit Ratio

panels.description: Request Cache Size
panels.title: Request Cache Size

panels.description: should be closed to 100%
panels.title: Request Cache Hit Ratio

panels.description: Field Data Memory Size
panels.title: Field Data Memory Size
